title: Bank Account
description: “Bank Account” sees 21 Savage rapping about his wealth over a dark beat produced by Metro Boomin and 21 Savage himself. The track samples Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson's 1974 song “Flashbulbs’s” The music video was released on November 10th, starring comedian Mike Epps and directed by Matt Swinsky.

annotations_with_timestamps.annotation: The phrase “get jiggy” originated from Will Smith’s 1998 hit single with the same name. It refers to getting into the groove on the dance floor and vibing with the music. “Skreets” derives from “streets,” and the term likely made its way into “proper” orthography well after the slang itself arose.

A 33-round Glock magazine is not a foot long, but it is about twice the length of a standard Glock magazine. Casper is a fictional character and the protagonist of the 1945 cartoon Casper the Friendly Ghost. “Mad mag” is wordplay on Mad Max’s name and a magazine, the part of the gun that stores ammunition.

A reference to a scene in the movie Boyz in the Hood when Lil Chris asked his friends if they wanted to go see a dead body that was laying in the bushes of an abandoned field. Lacoste is a French clothing brand that is much less luxurious than the designer brand Gucci. 21 is saying his adversaries' choice of clothing is sub par compared to his Gucci.

A “Draco” is a Romanian shortened AK-47 assault rifle. The term gained a sizable amount of attention in the hip-hop universe due to Soulja Boy. Chingy incorporated a local dance craze called “The Chicken Head” in the music video for his 2003 hit “Right Thurr” The Chicken Head is done by propping your arms up around your chest, bending your knees, stepping in a circle, and moving your arms like a chicken.

In a July 2017 interview with Real 92.3, 21 shut down the reports that Drake had bought him a Ferrari for his birthday. 21 stated that Drake rented the Ferrari for 21 to drive during his visit to LA, but did not actually purchase the car, in contrast to prior belief. A Ferrari is reported to have a top speed of 211 mph, making it one of the fastest cars in the world.

21 Savage brags about the fact that he now has fame and fortune to afford his upscale lifestyle in Hollywood. The Hills, (typical known as “The Hollywood Hills”) are a part of the Santa Monica Mountains and a hillside neighborhood in the central region of the city of Los Angeles, California. 21 Savage might also be referring to Jermaine O'Neal and Reggie Miller.

Neiman Marcus is a high-end American department store that is known for their designer clothing, footwear, furniture, jewelry and beauty products. A “light fifty” is spending $50,000 so easy and without doubts that it clearly means nothing to you. The average measurement for a ruler is 12 inches. 21 compares his penis to the measurement of a ruler.

Tennis chains are a type of men’s chain that are typically thin, long, and are often filled with diamonds. Inhalers are portable devices used to treat asthma that look like smoke when they're released. Even though smoking weed can’t manifest asthma, it can make existing asthma worse or even bring on asthma attacks. “Gas” is slang for marijuana.
